net.sf.jclal.sampling.supervised

Class Resample

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.sampling.AbstractSampling
      • net.sf.jclal.sampling.supervised.Resample
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, IConfigure, ISampling, ITool, JCLAL

    public class Resample
extends AbstractSampling
    Produces a random subsample of a dataset using either sampling with replacement or without replacement. The number of instances in the generated dataset may be specified. The dataset must have a nominal class attribute. If not, use the unsupervised version. The filter can be made to maintain the class distribution in the subsample, or to bias the class distribution toward a uniform distribution. This class must be used on single-label data. It is an adaptation of weka.filters.supervised.instance.Resample class of Weka.
    Author:
    Oscar Gabriel Reyes Pupo, Eduardo Perez Perdomo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getBiasToUniformClass

        public double getBiasToUniformClass()
        The degree of bias towards uniform (nominal) class distribution. Bias factor towards uniform class distribution. 0 = distribution in input data -- 1 = uniform distribution. (default 0)
        Returns:
        Returns the bias used.

      • setBiasToUniformClass

        The degree of bias towards uniform (nominal) class distribution. Bias factor towards uniform class distribution. 0 = distribution in input data -- 1 = uniform distribution. (default 0)
        Parameters:
        biasToUniformClass - The bias to use.
